title.text: A geo-coding service encompassing a geo-parsing tool and integrated digital gazetteer service

abstractContent.text: We describe a basic Geo-coding service encompassing a geo-parsing tool and integrated digital gazetteer service.

The development of a geo-parser comes from the need to explicitly georeference large resource collections such as the Statistical Accounts of Scotland which currently only contain implicit georeferences in the form of placennames thus making such collections inherently geographically searchable.

introductionContent.text: The project is being undertaken by the Edinburgh University Data Library (Edina) as apart of the larger geoXwalk (www.geoXwalk.ac.uk) project which aims to develop a protocol based (ADL, OGC and Z39.50) UK digital gazetteer service.

entities.text: OGC and Z39.50) UK digital gazetteer

introductionContent.text: The geo-parser uses the geoXwalk server as the name authority for identified placename candidates.
